abstract: Sanofi-Aventis, France’s largest drug maker, arranged about $10 billion of underwritten loans to back its bid for the American biotechnology company Genzyme, two people familiar with the situation said.
snippet: Sanofi-Aventis, France’s largest drug maker, arranged about $10 billion of underwritten loans to back its bid for the American biotechnology company Genzyme, two people familiar with the situation said.
lead_paragraph: Sanofi-Aventis, France’s largest drug maker, arranged about $10 billion of underwritten loans to back its bid for the United States biotechnology company Genzyme, two people familiar with the situation told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Sanofi Said to Line Up $10 Billion in Loans for Genzyme
